description:
Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

CAREER GROWTH

At Our Core, We Are Committed To Believing And Investing In Our Workforce Through

Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company-wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic.

Skill Development: Helping our employees grow their foundational skills

Finding the Dream Career at IBM:Navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirations

Diversity of People: Diversity of thought driving collective innovation

In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.

CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP

With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.html

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


BS in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or AI
3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Master’s degree in quantitative Field
Demonstrated leadership abilities, with team leader or managerial experience preferred
Proficiency with dealing with big data (Spark)
Hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
Experience working in a consulting or services environment


About Business Unit

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

Benefits

In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to

IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work.


12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.
World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.
Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.
Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).
Select educational reimbursement opportunities.
Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.
Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.
Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.


We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment

Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

CAREER GROWTH

At Our Core, We Are Committed To Believing And Investing In Our Workforce Through

Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company-wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic.

Skill Development: Helping our employees grow their foundational skills

Finding the Dream Career at IBM:Navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirations

Diversity of People: Diversity of thought driving collective innovation

In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.

CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP

With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.html

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


BS in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or AI
3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Master’s degree in quantitative Field
Demonstrated leadership abilities, with team leader or managerial experience preferred
Proficiency with dealing with big data (Spark)
Hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
Experience working in a consulting or services environment

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to

Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

CAREER GROWTH

At Our Core, We Are Committed To Believing And Investing In Our Workforce Through

Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company-wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic.

Skill Development: Helping our employees grow their foundational skills

Finding the Dream Career at IBM:Navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirations

Diversity of People: Diversity of thought driving collective innovation

In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.

CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP

With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.html

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


BS in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or AI
3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Master’s degree in quantitative Field
Demonstrated leadership abilities, with team leader or managerial experience preferred
Proficiency with dealing with big data (Spark)
Hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
Experience working in a consulting or services environment

Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


BS in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or AI
3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Master’s degree in quantitative Field
Demonstrated leadership abilities, with team leader or managerial experience preferred
Proficiency with dealing with big data (Spark)
Hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
Experience working in a consulting or services environment

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment

Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

CAREER GROWTH

At Our Core, We Are Committed To Believing And Investing In Our Workforce Through

Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company-wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic.

Skill Development: Helping our employees grow their foundational skills

Finding the Dream Career at IBM:Navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirations

Diversity of People: Diversity of thought driving collective innovation

In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.

CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP

With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.html

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


BS in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or AI
3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Master’s degree in quantitative Field
Demonstrated leadership abilities, with team leader or managerial experience preferred
Proficiency with dealing with big data (Spark)
Hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
Experience working in a consulting or services environment

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to

Introduction

As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

CAREER GROWTH

At Our Core, We Are Committed To Believing And Investing In Our Workforce Through

Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company-wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic.

Skill Development: Helping our employees grow their foundational skills

Finding the Dream Career at IBM:Navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirations

Diversity of People: Diversity of thought driving collective innovation

In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.

CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP

With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.html

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


BS in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or AI
3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Master’s degree in quantitative Field
Demonstrated leadership abilities, with team leader or managerial experience preferred
Proficiency with dealing with big data (Spark)
Hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
Experience working in a consulting or services environment

Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Managing Data Scientist Consultant at IBM Global Business Services, you will apply state of art AI techniques to address critical customer problems, add intelligence to automate manual workflows and drive tangible business value. You will be exposed a wide variety of problems that are clients are faced with – examples include finding defects in transmission lines using visual AI to using Natural Language Processing techniques to extract entities in a legal document.

This position is a Managing Data Scientist role with IBM Global Business Services, focusing on the design, development, and implementation of AI models and applications to solve client problems and drive business outcomes. Your responsibilities will include


Managing a team of data scientists and full stack developer to deliver on clients needs
Hands on management of the end-to-end AI lifecycle - data collection and preparation, exploratory data analysis, model selection/testing/validation, systematic model explainability, model interpretation in business terms and deploying the model for serving
Working with clients to understand their business needs, translate business problems into AI solutions and apply best practices and communicating findings back to the client
Lead workstreams and serve as a mentor for other data scientist
Willingness to travel up to 75% to client sites upon a mutual “return to work” initiative starting


If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $126,000 to $194,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

POST COVIDyou are expected to travel up to 75% (4 days a week) of the time to meet our client needs across the US.

Benefits

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/

CAREER GROWTH

At Our Core, We Are Committed To Believing And Investing In Our Workforce Through

Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company-wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic.

Skill Development: Helping our employees grow their foundational skills

Finding the Dream Career at IBM:Navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirations

Diversity of People: Diversity of thought driving collective innovation

In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.

CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP

With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.html

http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


BS in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or AI
3+ years of proficiency in Python
3+ years of experience with applying deep learning and machine learning techniques to solve problems
3+ years of Experience with common Python libraries used by data scientists (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.) and deep learning libraries (pytorch or Tesnorflow)
Experience working with structured and unstructured data
Experience building end-to-end data pipelines and deploying in the Cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Experience in Agile development
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate in a team environment


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Master’s degree in quantitative Field
Demonstrated leadership abilities, with team leader or managerial experience preferred
Proficiency with dealing with big data (Spark)
Hands-on experience deploying analytical models to solve business problems
Experience working in a consulting or services environment


About Business Unit

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

Benefits

In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to

IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work.


12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.
World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.
Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.
Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).
Select educational reimbursement opportunities.
Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.
Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.
Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.


We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Research & Insights, Deloitte Services LLP

We are looking for a teammate who will bring a blend of thoughtful, data driven curiosity and pragmatism. If you want to both design and deploy impactful, data-driven research to a global audience, then we want you on our team.

Data Science and Survey Advisory Services, Research & Insights Data Scientists play a key role developing research products that work to change perspectives on major business and government issues. Our Data Scientists are involved in all stages of the research process including working with internal clients to define research projects, research execution, presenting findings, and co-authoring public facing research reports. Strong candidates will be both thorough and creative in their research approaches, comfortable with public speaking, precise & concise writers, and able to both deliver and receive candid feedback.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Executes end-to-end research processes, working with internal clients to define research topics to conducting rigorous analysis. Ensures research utilizes appropriate methodologies (multivariate statistical modeling, text analytics, network analysis, time series analysis, econometrics, psychometrics, etc.)
Works collaboratively on a service-oriented team which supports numerous research requests covering multiple industry areas (e.g., consumer, energy, finance, government, media, technology, etc.)
Balances the demands of multiple long-term projects simultaneously
Presents on research findings to senior leadership both within and outside of Deloitte

Our Data Scientists play a key role in generating research into pivotal phenomena impacting US businesses and the US government. Our Data Scientists are required to occasionally travel (a few times a year at most) to attend offsite meetings, conferences, and/or training sessions.

Required Skills and Capabilities:

Experience with Python and/or R
Prior experience that has involved extensive use of at least two of the methodologies below:
Econometrics/Statistical Modeling (Linear Regression, Time Series Analysis, etc.)
Interactive Visuals (Power BI, MarketSight, Tableau, Qlik, etc.)
Machine Learning (Random Forests, Clustering, etc.)
Text Analytics (Topic Modeling, Natural Language Processing, Sentiment Analysis, etc.)
Network Analysis (Particularly Social)
Neural Networks (Artificial, Convolutional, or Recurrent)
Geostatistics/Spatial Modeling (Geographic information Systems, Spatial Regression, etc.)
Bachelors degree in Data Science, Statistics, Quantitative Behavioral Science other highly quantitative field
Travel up to 10% (While 10% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Desired Skills and Capabilities:

Masters or PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Quantitative Behavioral Science or other highly quantitative field
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as in a collaborative team environment
Prior publication of work (please provide links if possible)
Experience managing data-driven research, from project ideation to deployment
Deep expertise in Python or R
Working knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language)
Familiarity with data visualization software, such as MarketSight, Power BI, Tableau, etc.

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)


Primary Location

Skillman, NJ flexible to other NJ sites

Philadelphia, PA

Minneapolis, MN

Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Working with Johnson & Johnson can change everything. Including YOU.

#JNJDataScience

Primary Location

United States-New Jersey-Skillman-199 Grandview Road

Other Locations

United States-New Jersey-Raritan, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Spring House, United States-Minnesota-Minneapolis

Organization

Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. (6077)

Job Function

R&D

Requisition ID

2105973674W

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)


Primary Location

Skillman, NJ flexible to other NJ sites

Philadelphia, PA

Minneapolis, MN

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. United States-New Jersey-Skillman-199 Grandview Road

Other Locations

United States-New Jersey-Raritan, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Spring House, United States-Minnesota-Minneapolis

Organization

Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. (6077)

Job Function

R&D

Requisition ID

2105973674W

We are recruiting a Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and implementing data architecture and engineering solutions that have a direct impact on J&J Deliver NA and End-to-End (E2E) business. Our function spans across the entire enterprise. This wide scope will enable the individual to work with various internal business units and external entities to help identify viable and data architecture opportunities and then conceive, develop, and implement data-focused data analytical solutions.

As part of our multifaceted Analytics Center of Excellence (COE), you'll be an individual contributor that takes ownership of tough business problems and builds creative solutions that support our E2E Supply Chain Deliver Organization. You'll push beyond current tools to deliver capabilities and solutions at the forefront of what is possible in the cloud building prototypes and scalable solutions.

The role will be instrumental in providing highly reliable, high-quality data & analytics solutions for our organization. You will define problems, identify data sources, then create the definition, design, and implementation of data science solutions. You will partner with regional data and analytics leads within both the Information Technology (IT) and Supply Chain organization to ensure delivery of North America (NA) Deliver analytics capabilities. You will help define and align with the data & analytics architecture across IT data & analytics groups in different sectors to improve opportunities as well as drive agile architecture to meet specific NA Deliver needs. We seek a creative problem solver who collaborates with business partners to bring forth new insights, challenge the status quo, and deliver innovation to enable our business through the effective use of technology.

Key Responsibilities

Create data science solutions that address measurable business problems within NA Deliver
Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept IT work into a production-maintained environment
Deploy systematic solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions
Ensure best practices are implemented in the areas of data science and machine learning
Conduct workshops and training sessions with other team members to introduce key data science concepts to change organizational behavior
Partner with Data Scientists and multi-functional teams to understand current processes; develop, pilot, and implement improvements incorporating results of data science use cases and POCs to deliver advanced analytics solutions
Work with cross-functional technology, analytics, and business team to convert use cases and POCs into technology-enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full-stack solutions, using Agile methodologies


Required

Qualifications

Undergrad in STEM or related field, e.g. statistics, operations research, computer science, mathematics required (Master’s preferred)
2 years of meaningful work experience in data analysis or related field (Data analyst or Scientist)
1 year in a role that creates a tangible business impact through analytics and data science
Solid understanding of data mining algorithms including machine learning techniques such as feature engineering, decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models
Proficiency in one or more statistical programming languages such as R, Python, or Scala
Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured analytical solutions
Experience in applying real-time, modern machine learning analytics, artificial intelligence, and/or natural language processing-based methods throughout operational workflows
Proficiency in SQL and solid understanding of creation and extraction of data from relational databases
Ability to rapidly understand business requirements, communicate expectations to cross-functional development teams, document data findings that can be easily understood


Preferred

Previous experience building scalable cloud solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Demonstrated familiarity with large data sets and understanding of data analysis workflows, as well as working across complex systems involving multiple data sets
Expertise in building scalable analytical solutions that can be automated
Proficiency in building complex machine learning solutions using neural networks and deep learning technologies
Demonstrated experience in creating business applications of MPP databases (i.e. AWS Redshift, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery)
Experience building solutions for file-based data architectures (i.e. Hadoop, DataBricks)
Previous experience with ETL and data migration technologies
Experience with testing suites and CI/CD integration for creating robust pipelines
Proficiency in deployment and monitoring of data science solutions into a production environment
Working knowledge of scalable data science and machine learning software (i.e. Spark and Databricks)
Experience with sharing results through data visualization tools and technologies (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)


Primary Location

Skillman, NJ flexible to other NJ sites

Philadelphia, PA

Minneapolis, MN

Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Working with Johnson & Johnson can change everything. Including YOU.
